lps.pr1
Class Map

java.lang.Object
  lps.pr1.Map

public class Map
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents the map that the player is going to explore. The map is made of places (rooms). We have no more than 20 rooms. It is responsible for controlling where the player is and going from one place to another. Additionally, it uses an OutputStream to print messages about what is happening during the game.

See Also:
PrintStream

Field Detail

_currentRoom

protected int _currentRoom
Room where the player stays

_rooms

protected Room[] _rooms
All the rooms contained in the map. The initial room is always the one stored in position 0.

Constructor Detail

Map

public Map(java.io.OutputStream out)
Constructor

Parameters:
out - The outputstream where the Map is going to flush all the information during the game
Method Detail

describeRoom

public void describeRoom()
It prints the description of the current room on the outputstream

changeRoom

public boolean changeRoom(Parser.Direction d)
It changes the current room according to the given direction. If it cannot change the room in this direction (there is a wall), then it writes a warning message on the outputstream. If it has changed the room, then it writes the room description on the outputstream.

Parameters:
d - The direction we want to walk to.
Returns:
true if we have arrived at the exit. False, otherwise.

initMap

public boolean initMap()
It creates the rooms contained in the map, sets the initial room where we are going to start the game and writes the description from the initial room on the outputstream

Returns:
True if there was no problems during the initialization. False, otherwise.

createRooms

protected int createRooms()
Creates all the rooms contained in the map

Returns:
The room number where the player starts the game

printHelp

public void printHelp(java.lang.String help)
It writes on the outputstream the information about the help

Parameters:
help - The string that contains the information about the help
